title: Antigravity vs vLLM: Which AI Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare Antigravity vs vLLM. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best AI tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between Antigravity and vLLM? These AI tools serve different but sometimes overlapping purposes, each with unique strengths. This comparison breaks down the key differences to help you decide.

sections.title: Overview: Antigravity vs vLLM
paragraphs: Antigravity (developer tools) is Antigravity is a revolutionary multi-agent AI code editor that debuted at #1 in December 2026 developer rankings. Completely free during preview, it features unique multi-agent orchestration where multiple AI agents collaborate on complex coding tasks, integrated Chrome browser automation for testing, and support for the latest models (Gemini 3 Pro, Claude Sonnet 4.5/Opus 4.5). Its key differentiator is multi-agent collaboration—a capability no competitor offers—enabling it to tackle complex projects autonomously.. It's known for code-editor, ai-agents, multi-agent.

vLLM (llm ops) is vLLM is an open-source library specifically designed for high-performance inference and serving of large language models (LLMs). Its key capability is the implementation of the PagedAttention algorithm, which dramatically improves memory efficiency and throughput by managing the KV cache in non-contiguous, paged memory, similar to virtual memory in operating systems. This makes it uniquely suited for developers and organizations needing to deploy LLMs at scale with minimal hardware requirements and maximum speed.. Users choose it for llm-inference, model-serving, high-throughput.

sections.title: Key Features
paragraphs: Antigravity: Multi-agent orchestration (unique feature), Integrated Chrome browser automation, Live preview and design-to-code

vLLM: PagedAttention algorithm for optimized KV cache memory management, Continuous batching for increased GPU utilization and throughput, Support for a wide range of Hugging Face models (LLaMA, Mistral, GPT-2, etc.)

verdict: Both Antigravity and vLLM are excellent AI tools. Your choice depends on specific needs: Antigravity for code-editor, vLLM for llm-inference.
